means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 普兰特职业名称，园丁，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“树苗，草”(young tree,herb)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 普兰特绰号，瘦弱者

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"工厂"之意。
means: factory ： 最普通用词，可泛指任何制造产品的地方。
mill ： 原义指粮食加工厂。现多指轻工业类的工厂。
plant ： 多指电力或机械制造方面的工厂。
works ： 多指钢铁等重工业方面的工厂，也指一些特定的厂。

sentence.Network_en: It will produce electricity more cheaply than a nuclear plant.
sentence.Network_cn: 它的发电成本要比核电站低。

sentence.Network_en: The plant acts as a sedative in treating neuralgia.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种植物被用作治疗神经痛时的镇静药。

sentence.Network_en: Her husband laboured at the plant for 17 years.
sentence.Network_cn: 她丈夫在厂里辛勤工作了17年。

phrase.cizu_name: have (或 keep) one's feet firmly planted on the gro

means.word_mean: 安置
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English plante 'seedling', plantian (verb), from Latin planta 'sprout, cutting' (later influenced by French plante) and plantare 'plant, fix in a place'

encyclopedia.content: P.L.A.N.T.简介 出处：英文 全称为Productive Location Ally on Nexus Technology。是指主要由调整者建造的新型殖民地。位于L5的这种殖民地大概有120座（CE71年有大约92座），已经成为逃避了在地球上的迫害的调整者的新的故乡。如同它的名字，P.L.A.N.T主要是进行研究和农业生产，但是它们的独特设计也藉由丰富的植物和流淌的水使其营造出一个充满活力、苍翠繁茂的自然环境。 这些沙漏风格结构由二个直径各十公里的圆盘状的生活区

entry.def: A plant is a living thing that grows in the earth and has a stem, leaves, and roots.

example.ex: Water each plant as often as required.
example.tran: 按要求经常给每一株植物浇水。

entry.def: When you plant a seed, plant, or young tree, you put it into the ground so that it will grow there.

example.ex: He says he plans to plant fruit trees and vegetables.
example.tran: 他说他打算种植果树和蔬菜。

entry.def: When someone plants land with a particular type of plant or crop, they put plants, seeds, or young trees into the land to grow them there.

example.ex: They plan to plant the area with grass and trees...
example.tran: 他们计划在这一地区种草植树。

example.ex: Recently much of their energy has gone into planting a large vegetable garden.
example.tran: 最近他们把很多精力投在种植大菜园上了。

entry.def: A plant is a factory or a place where power is produced.

example.tran: 福特公司在英国的汽车装配厂

example.ex: The plant provides forty per cent of the country's electricity.
example.tran: 全国总电量的40%是这家发电厂提供的。

entry.tran: 成套机械；成套设备；成套装置
entry.def: Plant is large machinery that is used in industrial processes.
If you plant something somewhere, you put it there firmly.

example.ex: She planted her feet wide and bent her knees slightly.
example.tran: 她双脚宽分站稳，膝盖微屈。

example.ex: ...with his enormous feet  planted heavily apart.
example.tran: 他的大脚重重地分开站好

entry.def: To plant something such as a bomb means to hide it somewhere so that it explodes or works there.

example.ex: So far no one has admitted planting the bomb.
example.tran: 到目前为止，还没有人承认是自己放了炸弹。

entry.tran: 把（武器、毒品等）栽赃（于某人）
entry.def: If something such as a weapon or drugs is planted on someone, it is put among their possessions or in their house so that they will be wrongly accused of a crime.

example.ex: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.
example.tran: 他声称毒品是有人栽赃陷害他。

entry.def: If an organization plants someone somewhere, they send that person there so that they can get information or watch someone secretly.

example.ex: Journalists informed police who planted an undercover detective to trap Smith.
example.tran: 记者通知了警方，后者于是为诱捕史密斯而安插了一名卧底侦探。

entry.def: If you plant a kiss on someone, you give them a kiss.

example.ex: She planted a kiss on each of his leathery cheeks.
example.tran: 她在他粗糙的面颊上左右各吻了一下。

entry.def: If you plant an idea in someone's mind, they begin to accept the idea without realizing that it has originally come from you and not from them.

example.ex: He hoped that he could plant the idea in such a way that Abramov would believe it was his own.
example.tran: 他希望能把这个想法注入阿布拉莫夫的头脑，但要让他相信这是他自己的念头。

means.word_mean: 1. buildings for carrying on industrial labor;

sentences.sentence: "they built a large plant to manufacture automobiles"

means.word_mean: 2. a living organism lacking the power of locomotion
3. something planted secretly for discovery by another;

sentences.sentence: "the police used a plant to trick the thieves"
"he claimed that the evidence against him was a plant"

means.word_mean: 4. an actor situated in the audience whose acting is rehearsed but seems spontaneous to the audience
1. put or set (seeds or seedlings) into the ground;
2. fix or set securely or deeply;

sentences.sentence: "He planted a knee in the back of his opponent"
"The dentist implanted a tooth in the gum"

means.word_mean: 3. set up or lay the groundwork for;
4. place into a river;
5. place something or someone in a certain position in order to secretly observe or deceive;
6. put firmly in the mind;

sentences.sentence: "Plant a thought in the students' minds"

example.en: Don't tell everything you know. You don't know who's a plant and who isn't.
example.zh: 别把你知道的什么事儿都说出来。你不知道谁是密探，谁不是

example.en: They left footprints as a plant to confuse the police.
example.zh: 他们留下脚印以迷惑警察，

example.en: They were planning to disgrace the mayor, using a plant.
example.zh: 那时他们在计划利用伪证以败坏市长的名声。

example.en: The basement is the plant where they hid stolen goods.
example.zh: 那地下室是他们窝藏赃物之处。

example.en: I planted one right on his nose.
example.zh: 我朝他的鼻子上猛击了一拳。

example.en: The sailor was planted at sea.
He tried to plant the stolen goods on me.

auth_sentence.content: Most striking is the change in Plant's voice.
auth_sentence.res_content: Most striking is the change in Plant's voice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Most striking is the change in Plant's voice.

auth_sentence.content: How does the nuclear plant at Bushehr fit in?
auth_sentence.res_content: How does the nuclear plant at Bushehr fit in?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How does the nuclear plant at Bushehr fit in?

auth_sentence.content: My father spent his whole life at this plant.
auth_sentence.res_content: My father spent his whole life at this plant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My father spent his whole life at this plant.

Sentence.sentence: That lets us avoid building costly plants or buying expensive power at peak usage time.
The 4-H girls planted trees and took care of them during the early stages of growth.
Trees and flowers have all been planted in the shopping center, making the atmosphere pleasant
Mass layoffs and plant closings have drawn plenty of headlines and public debate over the years, and they still occasionally do.

In a late 1990s study of blue-collar employees at a General Motors plant (now closed) in Linden, N. J., the sociologist Ruth Milkman of City University of New York found that many line workers, in their off-hours, did home renovation and other skilled work.
In addition, at that time a greater percentage of homes and electrical plants were run on petroleum than today.

means.word_mean: 植物

sentences.en: Hot climate and plentiful rainfall favour the growth of plants.
sentences.cn: 炎热的气候和充足的雨水有助于植物生长。

means.word_mean: 工厂

sentences.en: They've decided on building a power plant there.
sentences.cn: 他们已决定在那里修建一座发电厂。

means.word_mean: 重型机械, 机械设备

sentences.en: They have made a huge investment in new plant.
sentences.cn: 他们投入巨资购置新设备。

放置; 安插

sentences.en: They must have planted many explosives there.
sentences.cn: 他们一定在这里埋了很多炸药。

means.word_mean: 在…内种上植物；给…种上植物

sentences.en: Large acreages have been planted to oil crops.
sentences.cn: 大面积土地已种上油料作物。

means.word_mean: 移植(动物、植物)；养(蚝等)；放养(鱼)

sentences.en: Zhoushan Islands is the underseas garden in which the oysters are planted, cultivated and harvested.
sentences.cn: 舟山群岛是放养、培育并收获牡蛎的海底养殖场。

means.word_mean: 丢弃；丢下

sentences.en: She planted her child on us while she went shopping.
sentences.cn: 她出去购物时把孩子丢给了我们。

means.word_mean: 建立；设立(教会、城镇、殖民地等)

sentences.en: They planted the first church in that part of the city.
sentences.cn: 他们在那座城市的那一部分创办了第一座教堂。

means.word_mean: 种植

sentences.en: This is perfect weather for planting.

jushi.english: They've decided on building a power plant there.
jushi.chinese: 他们已决定在那里修建一座发电厂。

jushi.english: A chemical plant is built here.
These plants have been forced so that they may be in flower by Christmas.
jushi.chinese: 这些植物已经过人工促长,到圣诞节就可能开花了。
